title: Jack Nicholson and Sean Penn keep a low-profile in Beverly Hills
title_page: Jack Nicholson and Sean Penn keep a low-profile in Beverly Hills | Daily Mail Online
text:
They both belong to an elite club in the gilded world of Tinsel Town being Oscar-winners.
So it was little surprise to see Hollywood Legends Jack Nicholson and Sean Penn enjoying a quiet night out on the town together, on Wednesday night - possibly reminiscing over past glories.
Following a meal at luxury Italian restaurant, E. Baldi, the 78-year-old The Shining star and the Milk actor, 55, appeared in high spirits as they left the upscale eatery.

The boys are back in town! Hollywood Legends Jack Nicholson and Sean Penn were seen enjoying a quiet night out on the town together, on Wednesday night - possibly reminiscing over past Oscar glories
The actors - who have worked in two movies together in their time, The Crossing Guard (1995) and The pledge (2001) - appeared to be relishing the chance to catch up with one another.
Leaving the restaurant it appeared that Sean and Jack were sharing a ride that night, as the Batman actor was seen waiting for Sean to pay for car parking.
Jack - who earned his first Oscar for his rile in One Flew Over The Cuckoos Nest - had opted for a classic staple in his wardrobe - a slick dark suit.

Wearing an open-necked purple silk shirt, the actor cut a smart yet understated figrue as he lounged against a wall.
Jack rounded hi smart look off by wearing a pair of black brogues.
Director and actor Sean went for a much more low-key look, with the Mystic River star stepping out in a gunmetal bomber jacket, tee-shirt, jeans and sneakers.
Catching up: The actors - who have worked in two movies together in their time, The Crossing Guard (1995) and The pledge (2001) - appeared to be relishing the chance to catch up with one another
With his greying hair in a slicked back centre-parting, the actor was instantly recognizable.
Hollywood's elite Sean Penn and Jack Nicholson leave a low-key dinner at E Baldi Italian restaurant in Beverly Hills. Penn has been doing his best to stay out of the limelight after the El Chapo Rolling Stone interview.
The duos outing comes not long after the actor sparked controversy by interviewing notorious Mexican gang leader Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman for Rolling Stone magazine.
While the interview has been widley discussed - praised and lambasted in equal measure - the star told recently explained his motivation behind the meeting.
Speaking to CBS 60 Minutes he said Guzman was someone through whom 'I could begin a conversation about the policy of the war on drugs. That was my simple idea'.
